reviewText: Good shipping and surprisingly clear for a standard DVD
Acting good a bit far fetched story line Tom Sizemore could have been less dramatic Corey sevier good as son

This is a very dark movie, do not watch it if you are depressed. I get what they were trying to get across but it is not a movie for light watching. There was a lot of off color language so if the offends you do not purchase. The ending is not what you expect so I suggest you watch it to the end.
i think this film is quite amazing into how we can become bored with our acceptance in how our life takes place an am able to transform it
I didn't care for this movie at all.  In fact, I never finished watching it. Too much cussing and just plain boring.

I saw 'A Broken Life' at a festival in Philadelphia and thought it was interesting. I felt like I was taken along with 'Max's (Tom Sizemore) journey and really like the Ving Rhames character which was some type of street person or maybe the grim reaper. I was told the film was shot in 14 days and that the director Neil Coombs had actually shot an entire feature film in one day The Last Hit. The end was a real surprise and I think it's worth watching.
